CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 31, 1956, page A1, reads: "Speakers' Table - Holding down the center of the speaker's table at the third annual Human Rights Dinner, sponsored by the local NAACP at the Gateway Plaza, were, left to right: Clarence Mitchell, guest speaker and director of the Washington D.C. NAACP office; Mayor David L. Lawrence, Mrs. Marion Jordon, executive secretary of the local NAACP affiliate; the Rev. Charles H. Foggie, local NAACP president; Councilman Paul F. Jones, chairman of the dinner, and John Golightly, local NAACP executive board member. - Harris Photo."David L. Lawrence was Mayor of the City of Pittsburgh 1946-1959, Governor of Pennsylvania 1959-1963, and he died in 1966.
TitMainTitle: Group portrait, from left, Clarence Mitchell, Pittsburgh Mayor David L. Lawrence, Marion Bond Jordon, Rev. Charles H. Foggie, Paul F. Jones, and John Golightly, seated at banquet table for Human Rights Dinner at Gateway Plaza, Downtown
